means: 对某人或某物流露出痴迷的神情

sentence.Network_en: There's enough variety here to make any [ botanist ] [ drool ] .
sentence.Network_cn: 这里的植物多样性足以让每个植物学家 喜出望外.

sentence.Network_en: It was really old and used to drool. It farted, too. Disgusting.
sentence.Network_cn: 它真的很老了, 而且流口水, 还会放屁呢, 真是恶心死了.

sentence.Network_en: Tears of joy , drool of joy — same thing, different duct.
sentence.Network_cn: 快乐的流眼泪,兴奋的流口水—这是一回事, 只是分泌管不同而已.

entry.tran: 对…过分痴迷;对…垂涎欲滴
entry.def: To drool over someone or something means to look at them with great pleasure, perhaps in an exaggerated or ridiculous way.

example.ex: Fashion editors drooled over every item...
example.tran: 时尚编辑们兴奋地注视着每一件东西。

example.ex: Advertisers are already drooling at reports that this might bring 20 million dollars.
example.tran: 广告商听闻这或许会带来2,000万美元的收益后已是垂涎欲滴了。

entry.def: If a person or animal drools, saliva drops slowly from their mouth.

example.ex: My dog Jacques is drooling on my shoulder.
example.tran: 我的狗雅克在我肩膀上流着口水。

means.word_mean: 1. pretentious or silly talk or writing
1. be envious, desirous, eager for, or extremely happy about something;

sentences.sentence: "She was salivating over the raise she anticipated"

means.word_mean: 2. let saliva drivel from the mouth;

auth_sentence.content: Yet you drool over Panda's Thumb, talkorigins and Wikipedia.

sentences.en: At the sight of the meat my dog started drooling.
sentences.cn: 我的狗一见到这块肉就开始流口水。

means.word_mean: 对某人或某物流露出痴迷的神情

sentences.en: He is always drooling over the singer.
sentences.cn: 他见到这位歌手总是会兴奋不已。

sentences.en: He was drooling all over you at the party!
sentences.cn: 晚会上他一直在痴迷地打量你！

sentences.en: The boys drooled over the sports cars in the showroom.
sentences.cn: 那些男孩给陈列室里的跑车迷住了。
